summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General memorandum analyzing surveillance video footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Special Housing Unit on August 9-10, 2019, surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It details staff assignments, movements, and failures to conduct required inmate counts and rounds. This document is a detailed timeline analysis of video surveillance footage from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on the night of August 9-10, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein died. It tracks the movements of correctional officers and inmates, specifically noting interactions around Epstein's cell on L tier and the activities of CO Noel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220, L tier) on August 10, 2019. The document details his movements on the evening of August 9, including being escorted to a shower cell for a phone call and later to his cell.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: BOP employee assigned to the MCC New York SHU on August 9-10, 2019. The report details her movements on video, her admission to prefilling count sheets, and her actions on the morning Epstein was found.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: BOP employee assigned to the MCC New York SHU on the morning watch shift starting at 12 a.m. on August 10, 2019. Admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and not conducting counts or rounds.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A BF CO frequently mentioned moving around the SHU, escorting inmates, carrying items like a phone and food tray, and performing counts. Her statements to the OIG are referenced for consistency.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Identified as Noel's attorney, through whom she provided a statement to the OIG regarding her 10 p.m. count.

connections.description: Both were BOP staff assigned to the SHU on the morning of August 10, 2019. They admitted to jointly prefilling count and round sheets and failing to conduct required checks.
Noel was a correctional officer assigned to Epstein's housing unit. The report details her providing him with dinner and being present when he was found unresponsive.
Jason Foy is identified as Noel's attorney, representing her in communications with the Office of the Inspector General (OIG).

events.title: Epstein's Evening Activities and Phone Call
events.description: Epstein was escorted from an attorney conference to the SHU shower cell on G tier for a phone call. A call was placed to 646-243-8517 from the SHU legal line at 6:58 p.m. and ended at 7:19 p.m. He was later escorted to his cell on L tier and given dinner.

events.title: Failure to Conduct 10 p.m. Inmate Count
events.description: Video review and interviews indicate that the required 10 p.m. inmate count in the SHU was not conducted by assigned officers. Instead, an officer conducted a round alone.

events.title: No Rounds or Counts Conducted from Midnight to 6 a.m.
events.description: Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and not conducting any of the required counts or rounds between 12:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., during breakfast feeding, Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on L tier. An officer activated a body alarm at 6:33 a.m.

events.title: Epstein Returned to Cell
events.description: At 19:49, a CO escorted Jeffrey Epstein from G tier across the SHU floor and up to his cell on L tier.

events.title: Noel's 10 p.m. Count
events.description: At 22:29, Noel walked to the laundry/SHU entrance area. She later stated via her attorney that this was when she performed the 10 p.m. inmate count.

events.title: Shift Change and 3 a.m. Count
events.description: At 0:01, CO Tameron reported for his shift. At 3:15, Noel entered the 105 office to assist with the 3 a.m. count, consistent with her statement.

events.title: 5 a.m. Count and Breakfast Preparation
events.description: At 5:26, Noel went to 105 to assist with the 5 a.m. count. Beginning around 6:22, officers including Noel and Thomas were involved in bringing breakfast to the SHU, moving food trays.

events.title: Increased Activity on L Tier
events.description: Starting around 6:30-6:34, multiple COs were seen moving hurriedly between L tier (Epstein's tier), the desk area, and the entrance, indicating a developing incident.

keyFacts: Only one surveillance camera inside the MCC New York SHU was recording on August 9-10, 2019; it provided a limited, low-quality view of the common area and stairs.

Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to falsifying official records by prefilling count and round sheets for August 10, 2019, and not conducting any counts or rounds from midnight to 6 a.m.
The required 10 p.m. inmate count on August 9, 2019, was not conducted by two officers as required; video shows only one officer walking the tiers.
Video analysis suggests staff were sleeping at the SHU officer desk area between approximately 1:05 a.m. and 3:10 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
The last time a correctional officer is believed to have entered the L tier (where Epstein's cell was) prior to 6 a.m. on August 10 was at 10:39 p.m. on August 9.
The document provides a minute-by-minute log of officer and inmate movement in the MCC SHU on the night leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Correctional Officer Tova Noel's movements and statements are a central focus, with her actions cross-referenced against her later accounts to investigators.
Epstein was escorted back to his cell on L tier at 7:49 p.m. on August 9th.
A period of hurried, multi-officer activity around Epstein's L tier begins at approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10th.
The report is part of OIG Case Number 2019-009707, investigating the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
